title: Royal finances: Where does the King get his money?
description: The government has confirmed how much money the Royal Family received from taxpayers in 2022.

title: Heating down but spending up for royal finances
description: Royal residences have the heating kept at 19C, as spending rises to almost £108m, annual accounts show.

title: 'Mum was sent to Ireland, shamed and had to give me up'
description: A woman sent from Britain to Ireland as a baby speaks about repatriations of unmarried Irish mothers.

title: Package holidays in Greece, Spain and Turkey soar in price
description: All-inclusive deals for some parts of Spain and Greece are more than 20% more expensive this year.

title: NHS staff sickness hits record high in England
description: The equivalent of 75,000 staff are lost to illness, as the absence rate jumps 29% since before the pandemic.

title: Wimbledon 2023: The ball boys from Barnardo's
description: When the list of the 60 teenagers selected to be Wimbledon ball boys went up in their Barnardo's children's home, it opened up a fortnight of unexpected opportunities.

title: Human remains thought to be found in Titan sub debris
description: US medical professionals will conduct a formal analysis of presumed remains, the coast guard said.

title: Declan Rice: Arsenal reach agreement to sign West Ham midfielder in £105m deal
description: Arsenal agree a deal worth £105m to sign West Ham's England midfielder Declan Rice.

title: Delta flight lands safely in Charlotte without front landing gear
description: The airline called it a "rare occurrence" and said all the passengers and crew members were safe.

title: Lords criticise University of East Anglia's arts jobs cut plan
description: The University of East Anglia (UEA) aims to lose more than 30 academic posts.

title: Luton Hoo's Ryder Cup bid golf course approved
description: The hotel's owners, Arora Group, have bid to host the Ryder Cup in either 2031 or 2035.

title: Johnson allies to be criticised over Partygate probe
description: Several supporters of the former PM took aim at the Commons committee that investigated him.

title: Three men held after girl, 13, goes missing from party
description: Carmelle Hepi, from Barnsley, travelled to London on Saturday for a party and has not been seen since.

title: James Maddison: Tottenham complete £40m deal for Leicester and England midfielder
description: Tottenham complete the £40m signing of Leicester City midfielder James Maddison on a five-year deal until 2028.

title: Madonna postpones tour after stay in intensive care
description: Madonna postpones world tour after stay in intensive care with serious bacterial infection.

title: Kai Havertz: Arsenal sign Chelsea forward in deal worth about £65m
description: Arsenal complete the £65m signing of Germany forward Kai Havertz on a five-year deal from Chelsea.

title: The Ashes 2023: England and Australia players told not to confront Just Stop Oil protesters
description: Jonny Bairstow's removal of a Just Stop Oil protester from the field on the first day of the second Ashes Test at Lord's came despite players being advised not to confront pitch invaders.

title: French HR murders: Gabriel Fortin sentenced to life in prison
description: Garbriel Fortin will spend up to 22 years in prison for the murder of three employment managers.

title: The Ashes 2023: England 'too casual' for Ashes cricket, says Michael Vaughan
description: England were "too casual" on day one of the second Ashes Test and must realise the contest "is not just another game", says ex-captain Michael Vaughan.

title: The Ashes 2023: England v Australia day one highlights
description: A lacklustre display from England and an ominous unbeaten 85 from Steve Smith give Australia much the better of the first day of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: European Under-21 Championship: England continue perfect start with 2-0 win over Germany
description: England continue their perfect start to the European Under-21 Championship with a 2-0 victory over Germany in their final group game.

title: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace to lose seat in Commons boundary changes
description: Independent commissions across the UK have reshaped the electoral map to reflect population changes.

title: The Ashes 2023: Steve Smith gives Australia edge over England at Lord's
description: A lacklustre display from England and an ominous 85 not out from Steve Smith gives Australia much the better of the first day of the second Ashes Test.

title: The Ashes: England's Joe Root dismisses Travis Head and Cameron Green in same over
description: Joe Root removes Travis Head and Cameron Green in the same over as England fight back against Australia on day one of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Flamborough: 'Miracle' dog survives huge coastal cliff fall
description: Button the Cockapoo was being walked in East Yorkshire when she suddenly disappeared out of sight.

title: Edouard Mendy: Saudi Arabian side Al-Ahli sign Chelsea goalkeeper
description: Senegal goalkeeper Edouard Mendy has left Chelsea after three years to join Saudi Pro League side Al-Ahli.

title: Rescue for Army veteran living on uninhabitable rock
description: Cam Cameron planned to spend 60 days living on the uninhabitable rock in the Outer Hebrides.

title: Simone Biles: American four-time Olympic champion set to return to competitive gymnastics
description: Four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles is set to make her return to competitive gymnastics at the 2023 US Classic in August.

title: Harry case hears of 'catastrophic effects' on Mirror Group
description: The newspaper publisher is facing "rocket-propelled litigation", the High Court hears.

title: Ukraine war: Three teens among 11 killed in Kramatorsk attack
description: Russian shelling injured at least 57 others visiting a popular restaurant in the eastern Ukrainian city.

title: What social media videos reveal about Paris teen's death

title: Korski pulls out of London mayoral race after groping claim
description: The Tory London mayoral hopeful denies assaulting novelist and TV producer Daisy Goodwin.

title: Titanic tourist sub photos show wreckage being brought ashore
description: New photos of debris from the vessel are taken in St John's, Canada, on Wednesday.

title: Grayson Perry accepts knighthood from Prince of Wales at Windsor Castle
description: The Turner Prize-winning artist is honoured by the Prince of Wales at Windsor Castle.

title: The Ashes 2023: Ollie Robinson removes Marnus Labuschagne for 47 after tea
description: England's Ollie Robinson removes Marnus Labuschagne for 47 after tea on day one of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: LIV Golf: Sergio Garcia says his feud with Rory McIlroy has been resolved
description: Sergio Garcia says he has rekindled his friendship with former Ryder Cup team mate Rory McIlroy.

title: Daniel Penny pleads not guilty in NY subway chokehold death of Jordan Neely
description: Daniel Penny, 24, denies second-degree manslaughter and negligent homicide in the death of Jordan Neely.

title: Swim England to ban weighing of children
description: Young athletes will not be weighed after swimmers spoke of developing eating disorders.

title: Dolphins, whales and seals not protected by UK government, report finds
description: Dolphins, whales and seals aren't protected as well in the UK as in other countries, a report finds.

title: 8 Ursae Minoris b: Scientists unlock mystery of planet that escaped death
description: A planet that should have been eaten by a huge star has baffled scientists until now.

title: Investigation into mental-health inpatient care in England
description: The government said deaths in hospital and young people's care would be examined, among other issues.

title: Kevin Spacey jury sworn in for sex offences trial
description: Opening arguments in the actor's trial over sexual offences, which he denies, will start on Friday.

title: Eastbourne International: Coco Gauff thrashes Jodie Burrage to reach quarter-finals
description: World number seven Coco Gauff thrashes Britain's Jodie Burrage to reach the quarter-finals of the Eastbourne International.

title: The Ashes 2023: Josh Tongue removes David Warner for 66
description: Josh Tongue picks up his second wicket as he removes Australia's David Warner for 66 on day one of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Stowaway African huntsman spider found in Edinburgh suitcase
description: The Scottish SPCA has quarantined the 10cm spider which was discovered at a property in Edinburgh.

title: Woman who killed husband loses appeal bid
description: Penelope Jackson stabbed her husband David to death following a meal at their home in Somerset.

title: Paris: Macron calls police killing of teen 'unforgivable'
description: His words followed the shooting of a 17-year-old who failed to obey traffic police in the Paris region.

title: Harry Kane transfer news: Where will Tottenham striker and Bayern Munich target end up?
description: Bayern Munich? Real Madrid? Paris St-Germain? Manchester United? Where will Tottenham striker Harry Kane end up?

title: PMQs: Starmer attacks Sunak over 'collapse' in housebuilding
description: The Labour leader says Rishi Sunak is "shuttering the dream" of those who want to own a home.

title: Eid al-Adha around the world: In pictures
description: People around the world observe Eid al-Adha, one of the most important festivals in the Muslim calendar.

title: BT investigated over major 999 call disruption
description: Probe launched after emergency services across the UK reported 999 calls were failing to connect on Sunday.

title: Ashes: Just Stop Oil protesters briefly disrupt opening morning of England v Australia Test at Lord's
description: Just Stop Oil protesters briefly disrupted the first morning of the second Ashes Test, with one carried off by England player Jonny Bairstow.

description: Protesters wearing Just Stop Oil T-shirts briefly disrupt the first morning of the second Ashes Test, with one carried off the Lord's ground by England wicketkeeper Jonny Bairstow.

title: Manchester United: Are football shirt launches becoming more creative?
description: Football kit launches are getting more inventive, like Aitch debuting Man United's new shirt at Glasto.

title: Donald Trump countersues writer E Jean Carroll for defamation
description: The former president alleges the writer falsely accused him of rape after a jury found he sexually abused her.

title: Government 'prepared' amid Thames Water collapse fears
description: It comes amid reports the company could be temporarily renationalised as struggles with its debts.

title: Queen's University Belfast: 10 students have degree results withdrawn
description: One of 10 graduates affected says it's "a kick in the teeth" while the university blames human error.

title: Daisy Goodwin makes assault complaint about Daniel Korski
description: Daisy Goodwin says she has reported Tory London mayoral hopeful Daniel Korski to the Cabinet Office.

title: The Ashes 2023: Issy Wong recalled by England for Ashes T20s but Tammy Beaumont left out
description: Bowler Issy Wong is recalled to England's squad for the T20 leg of the women's Ashes but there is no place for batter Tammy Beaumont.

title: Declan Rice: Arsenal make third bid worth £105m for West Ham midfielder
description: Arsenal submit a third bid worth £105m for West Ham and England midfielder Declan Rice.

title: Michael Rosen 'honoured' to win PEN Pinter Prize
description: The author and poet is described by judges as "one of our most tenacious and fearless writers".

title: Harry Kane: Bayern Munich set to make improved offer for Tottenham forward
description: Bayern Munich are set to make an improved offer for Tottenham and England forward Harry Kane.

title: James Maddison: Tottenham close in on £40m deal for Leicester and England midfielder
description: Tottenham Hotspur are close to completing a £40m deal for Leicester City midfielder James Maddison.

title: Watch: Teen makes skateboarding history with ‘720’ trick
description: Thirteen-year-old skateboarder Arisa Trew becomes the first woman to land a 720 in a competition.

title: Watch: Meeting the King and Queen in your bathrobe
description: Guests at a luxury spa interrupt their session to meet the King and Queen on a visit to Poundbury.

title: 'It's so disheartening' - Dolly Parton tribute act stages protest over Meta 'ban'
description: Tribute acts protested outside Meta's London HQ after their Facebook and Instagram profiles were deleted.

title: Natasha Jonas column: 'For the first time in my career, I'm calling the shots'
description: In her BBC Sport column, Natasha Jonas says she is calling the shots for the first time in her career as she bids to become a two-weight world champion on Saturday.

title: The people making money from the pain of soaring prices
description: The BBC gains exclusive access to illegal moneylenders who are charging interest rates of up to 50%.

title: The fear that gives Western leaders sleepless nights
description: Senior officials suggest the Russian leader cannot survive a catastrophic loss of authority.

title: South Koreans become a year younger under new age-counting law
description: Seoul scraps a centuries-old age-counting system in favour of international standards.

title: Universal credit: Parents can claim more of their childcare costs
description: Working families on universal credit can claim more of their childcare costs from Wednesday.

title: Estimated 700,000 pupils in unsafe school buildings, NAO says
description: There is a "critical" risk a school building could collapse, the National Audit Office says.

title: The Papers: Hancock before Covid Inquiry and doctors to strike
description: Matt Hancock's evidence at the Covid Inquiry and a vote by senior doctors to walk out lead the papers.

title: Van life is far from glamorous on LA's streets
description: "Van lords" profit from LA's housing crisis by renting motorhomes to those living on the edge, critics say.

title: Indiana Jones: Harrison Ford says he wanted 'emotional ending'
description: The actor is playing the character for the final time in the fifth instalment of the franchise.
